_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary


Hickory Springs Manufacturing Company, d/b/a HSM, is committed to operating and maintaining its facilities and processes in a safe and responsible manner, which provides safe conditions for Company employees, the surrounding community and the environment.

Our HSM-Americus facility manufactures flexible polyurethane (PU) foam products for a variety of industries. One of the major chemical ingredients used in the PU foam manufacturing process is Toluene diisocyanate (mixed isomers) (TDI), CAS # 26471-62-5. Our TDI inventory is maintained above 10,000 lbs. In accordance with the provisions of 40 CFR Part 68 (Chemical Accident Prevention Regulations), the worst case scenario was defined as the rupture of, and the immediate spillage of, the contents of a TDI railcar into a concrete containment area. The impact of this spill was evaluated using the ALOHA model (ver. 5.4.4) and resulted in the area of concern being confined within the facility's property boundary with no public receptors being affected. The release rate calculated by the ALOHA model was 0.0265 lbs./min.

This facility has an OSHA HAZWOPER trained Hazmat Team, which will provide initial response to any and all spills, despite the substance or .

This facility also has contracted professional emergency responders as back-up. The facility's Emergency Response Plan, prepared in accordance with 29 CFR 1910.120(q), has been coordinated with the LEPC and the local fire department. All facility employees responsible for the handling and control of hazardous substances are provided initial and refresher training in proper procedures as required by the USEPA, OSHA and DOT regulatory requirements.

In accordance with 40 CFR Part 68.42, there have been no accidental releases of TDI at this facility within the last five years.

No changes to the procedures or methods of pollution prevention are to be made at this time. Procedural changes may be implemented in the future if revaluation
